item.description:
Co-sponsored with the Southeast CT Adventures Meetup -- please check their page, too, for more information and attendees :). http://www.meetup.com/sect-adventurers/events/69465352/

See this site for info on the state park: http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?a=2716&q=325238

On the weekend after Independence Day, we will follow the footsteps of a notable figure in the Revolutionary War - General Israel Putnam - into the mouth of the Wolf Den itself.

If we survive that adventure, we'll also hike past Table Rock and Indian Chair.

Please note we will be meeting at the Wolf Den Campground Parking area, NOT in the parking area at the main entrance off Rt. 44. Directions for getting to the Wolf Den Campground are listed below.

Just found out that leashed dogs are OK to come :)

DISTANCE: 3.9 miles (approx)

ELAPSED TIME: 2.5 hr (approx)

ELEVATION GAIN (APPROX): TBD

 

HIKE PLAN: Looping hike starting/ending at ... Clockwise looping hike starting/ending at the Wolf Den Campground visitor parking lot in the campground area.  We will start on the blue-blazed trail and continue along a mix of red/blue and blue back to the point of origin.

TRAIL MAP: Mashamoquet Brook State Park hiking map

HIKE START TIME: Feet will hit the trail promptly at 10:30am, so please aim to be at the parking lot no later than 10:15am.

HIKE LOGISTICS: We will congregate in the parking area - Look for me holding a SOUTHEAST CT ADVENTURES sign.

From the east/(Providence, RI): Take Route 6 west onto Route 101 west. Continue west on Route 101, going ~1/4 mile past the junction with Route 169. Watch for a sign on your left for the Wolf Den Campground. Take the left onto Wolf Den Drive, and follow it until you come to the campground entrance on your left.

From the south/(Norwich): Take Route 395 north, Exit 93. At the end of the exit ramp, take a left onto Route 101 West. Continue west on Route 101, going ~1/4 mile past the junction with Route 169. Watch for a sign on your left for the Wolf Den Campground. Take the left onto Wolf Den Drive, and follow it until you come to the campground entrance on your left.

Learn more about Mashamoquet Brook State Park.

 

Those who wish to go should have:

* A daypack or lumbar pack - To carry trail food, water, and any extra items

* At least 1 quart (1 liter) drinking water

* Hiking boots advised

* Bug spray advised (to repel ticks and other pesky insects; see this publication for discussion of tick and insect repellents)

Please check the SE CT Adventures page linked above the morning of the hike for weather status. If you need to call for more information, my cell number is 860-634-6541
